meanings.definition: The quality of a color as determined by its dominant wavelength and intensity.
meanings.sent1: The chrominances of the painting made it stand out in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the chrominances of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The artist exaggerated the chrominances of the sky to create a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent4: The chrominances of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The chrominances of the rainbow were a beautiful sight after the rain.

meanings.definition: The difference in color between two objects.
meanings.sent1: The chrominances between the two cars made it easy to tell them apart.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't ignore the chrominances between the old and new curtains.
meanings.sent3: The chrominances between the identical twins confused their friends.
meanings.sent4: The chrominances between the leaves on the trees signaled the change of season.
meanings.sent5: The chrominances between the two paintings were strikingly different.
